section.title: secret (string)
section.para: The secret string used to generate nonce. Inclusion of this string in nonce ensures that only the proxy server that knows the secret string will be able to generate the nonce and verify it later when received from the user agent.
Default value is randomly generated string.

section.title: log_level (integer)
section.para: Log level at which accounting messages are issued to syslog.
Default value is L_NOTICE.

section.title: log_fmt (string)
section.para: Defines what parts of header fields will be printed to syslog, see "overview" for list of accepted values.
Default value is "miocfs".

section.title: early_media (integer)
section.para: Should be early media (183) accounted too ?
Default value is 0 (no).

section.title: failed_transactions (integer)
section.para: This parameter controls whether failed transactions (with final reply >= 300) should be accounted too.
Default value is 0 (no).

section.title: log_flag (integer)
section.para: Request flag which needs to be set to account a transaction.
Default value is 1.

section.title: log_missed_flag (integer)
section.para: Request flag which needs to be set to account missed calls.
Default value is 2.

section.title: report_ack (integer)
section.para: Shall acc attempt to account e2e ACKs too ? Note that this is really only an attempt, as e2e ACKs may take a different path (unless RR enabled) and mismatch original INVITE (e2e ACKs are a separate transaction).
Default value is 1 (yes).

section.title: report_cancels (integer)
section.para: By default, CANCEL reporting is disabled -- most accounting applications are happy to see INVITE's cancellation status. Turn on if you explicitly want to account CANCEL transactions.
Default value is 0 (no).

section.title: radius_config (string)
section.para: This parameter is radius specific. Path to radius client configuration file, set the referred config file correctly and specify there address of server, shared secret (should equal that in /usr/local/etc/raddb/clients for freeRadius servers) and dictionary, see etc for an example of config file and dictionary.
Default value is /usr/local/etc/radiusclient/radiusclient.conf.

section.title: service_type (integer)
section.para: Radius service type used for accounting.
Default value is 15 (SIP).

section.title: radius_flag (integer)
section.para: Request flag which needs to be set to account a transaction -- RADIUS specific.
Default value is 1.

section.title: radius_missed_flag (integer)
section.para: Request flag which needs to be set to account missed calls -- RADIUS specific.
Default value is 2.

section.title: db_url (string)
section.para: SQL address -- database specific.
Default value is "mysql://ser:heslo@localhost/ser"

section.title: db_flag (integer)
section.para: Request flag which needs to be set to account a transaction -- database specific.
Default value is 1.

section.title: db_missed_flag (integer)
section.para: Request flag which needs to be set to account missed calls -- database specific.
Default value is 2.

section.title: diameter_flag (integer)
section.para: Request flag which needs to be set to account a transaction -- DIAMETER specific.
Default value is 1.

section.title: diameter_missed_flag (integer)
section.para: Request flag which needs to be set to account missed calls -- DIAMETER specific.
Default value is 2.

section.title: diameter_client_host (string)
section.para: Hostname of the machine where the DIAMETER Client is running -- DIAMETER specific.
Default value is "localhost".

section.title: diameter_client_port (int)
section.para: Port number where the Diameter Client is listening -- DIAMETER specific.
Default value is 3000.
